result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Mitchell in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Michael Mitchell in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Michael Mitchell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 36 MONTHS, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, STAYED until next court date.
-Be supervised by the Mental Health Unit-
-Mental health assessment and comply with all treatment.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Obtain employment as able.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
*
AS TO COUNT 3:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 233 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 233 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Mitchell in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Michael Mitchell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
received and filed.  rmm
Invoice forwarded to accounts payables in the amount of $593.75 to Dr.Collins for services on 09-23-14, 09-28-14, 10-06-14.Copy in file.

Defendant Michael Mitchell in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Michael Mitchell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Br. 4 for Br. 40: 
Defense counsel raised a concern about the competency of defendant, and is requesting a further evaluation.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 40 on 12-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Branch 4 agreed to take the case.  File sent to Branch 4 forthwith.
Order Reinstating Defendant's Telephone/Mail/Visitation Privileges signed and filed.  rmm

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  The 11/10/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.

Defendant Michael Mitchell in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Michael Mitchell in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Doctor's report reviewed by the parties.  Dr. Deborah Collins indicated she could not support a NGI plea.  Parties do not dispute the findings.
received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Michael Mitchell in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Michael Mitchell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Deborah Collins be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 40.  Filed, signed Order for Examination.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
from the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Dudley is ill and requested an adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defense will file a response with the Court by 7/28/14.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
